results.title: A Tribute to Sir Winston Churchill, K.G.
results.brief_description: A biographical film in honour of Sir Winston Churchill’s 80th birthday, dealing with his early life, education and his emergence into public life. It goes on to recall details of his political career, particularly as Britain’s leader throughout the war years, and ends with the presentation made to him by the two Houses of Parliament at a ceremony in Westminster Hall on the occasion of his 80th birthday.

results.title: A Tribute to James Cagney. 'Great guy'. 'Blood on the sun
results.brief_description: Great guy - ex prizefighter Cagney wages a war against graft and corruption in the food business by using the mob’s own methods to beat them. Stars James Cagney and Mae West. “Blood on the sun” - In the Twenties, the American editor of a Tokyo newspaper reveals a Japanese militarist plan for world conquest.

results.title: A Tree is planted
results.creator_credit: Campbell Harper Films and Films of Scotland
results.brief_description: An account of the work of re-afforestation being carried out year by year in Scotland. Shows the men who work in the Scottish forests and stresses the vital need for reafforestation and tree care, pointing to the numerous skills which are part of the everyday job.

results.title: A Tree is a living thing
results.creator_credit: Rene Jodoin, ONF | NFB and Vincent Vaitiekunas
results.brief_description: For all children, but especially for those studying natural science in elementary grades, this film shows an aspect of life they will understand and enjoy. A motion picture camera linked to a high-powered microscope shows the miracle of the leaf as it turns sunlight into chlorophyll. The film also shows how a tree feeds, breathes, and grows.

results.title: A Tree grows in Brooklyn [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Louis D Lighton, Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation and Elia Kazan
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by Betty Smith, “A Tree grows in Brooklyn” follows the fortunes of a family struggling to make ends meet in the tenements of Brooklyn at the turn of the century. The alcoholic father, a singing waiter earning an uncertain income, talks of better times ahead. It is the mother who holds the family together and the daughter who tries to rise above their circumstances. Elia Kazan’s first film was praised at the time of its release for convincing performances and the richly detailed studio recreation of working class life. Cast includes: Dorothy McGuire, Joan Blondell, James Dunn, Lloyd Nolan and Peggy Ann Garner. Music by Alfred Newman.

results.title: A Trail of destruction
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Jeremy Somerville and ACMI
results.brief_description:
The whole thing probably lasted about twenty seconds, but for Jeremy Somerville, his family and community, it is an event they will never forget.
On the 3rd of June 2010, the residents of Lennox Head, on the North Coast of New South Wales, were preparing for the day ahead when their town was struck by a tornado.

results.title: A Track winding back (A)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian story (Television program)”.
This documentary is based on a true story written by school teacher Carolyn Landon about bushman, Daryl Tonkin and his life and memories of Jackson’s Track in West Gippsland, Victoria. It is a story of love and tragedy, of an Aboriginal community living and working harmoniously with white people in the timber industry in the forest area of Jackson’s Track established by Daryl and his brother Harry during the 1930s. It tells of Daryl’s feud with his family when he decided to live with an Aboriginal woman, the dramatic kidnapping of this woman by his brother, Daryl’s life with the Aboriginal community and the eventual bull-dozing of the camp in the 1960s to appease local Christian groups resulting in the break-up and dispersal of the almost 100 people living at the camp. Daryl talks of himself as being at one with the Aboriginal way of life, a true bushman, who saw his life neither primitive nor of poverty and hardship, but as being his preferred way of life. Includes interviews with two of his nine children, re-enactments, stills and archival footage, and excerpts from the film “Rose against the odds”. Contains some b&w images.

results.title: A Track winding back
results.brief_description: Presents a sketch of life in Gundagai, NSW around the turn of the century utilising contemporary photographs and written records. Covers architecture, fashion, medicine, politics, problems of workers, the departure of troops for the Boer War and the celebration of Commonwealth Day.
